    Package
    Description
    org.sibermatica.lang.text
    As of 3.6, use the Apache Commons Text text package.
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate
    As of 3.6, use the Apache Commons Text translate package.

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    net.sibermatica.ftp.FTPCommand
    use FTPCmd instead
    net.sibermatica.ftp.FTPSCommand
    3.0 DO NOT USE
    net.sibermatica.ftp.FTPSTrustManager
    3.0 use TrustManagerUtils#getValidateServerCertificateTrustManager() instead
    net.sibermatica.nntp.ArticlePointer
    3.0 use ArticleInfo instead
    org.sibermatica.io.CopyUtils
    Use IOUtils. Will be removed in 3.0. Methods renamed to IOUtils.write() or IOUtils.copy(). Null handling behavior changed in IOUtils (null data does not throw NullPointerException).
    org.sibermatica.io.DirectoryWalker
    Apache Commons IO no longer uses this class. Instead, use PathUtils.walk(java.nio.file.Path, org.sibermatica.io.file.PathFilter, int, boolean, java.nio.file.FileVisitOption...) or Files.walkFileTree(java.nio.file.Path, java.util.Set, int, java.nio.file.FileVisitor), and friends.
    org.sibermatica.io.FileCleaner
    Use FileCleaningTracker
    org.sibermatica.io.filefilter.WildcardFilter
    Use WildcardFileFilter. Deprecated as this class performs directory filtering which it shouldn't do, but that can't be removed due to compatibility.
    org.sibermatica.io.FileSystemUtils
    As of 2.6 deprecated without replacement. Use equivalent methods in FileStore instead, e.g. Files.getFileStore(Paths.get("/home")).getUsableSpace() or iterate over FileSystems.getDefault().getFileStores()
    org.sibermatica.lang.CharEncoding
    Java 7 introduced StandardCharsets, which defines these constants as Charset objects. Use Charset.name() to get the string values provided in this class. This class will be removed in a future release.
    org.sibermatica.lang.Functions
    Use Failable.
    org.sibermatica.lang.RandomUtils
    Use Apache Commons RNG's optimized UniformRandomProvider
    org.sibermatica.lang.Streams
    Use Streams.
    org.sibermatica.lang.Streams.ArrayCollector
    Use Streams.ArrayCollector.
    org.sibermatica.lang.Streams.FailableStream
    Use Streams.FailableStream.
    org.sibermatica.lang.StringEscapeUtils
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text StringEscapeUtils instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.CompositeFormat
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text CompositeFormat instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.ExtendedMessageFormat
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text ExtendedMessageFormat instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.FormattableUtils
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text FormattableUtils instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.StrBuilder
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text TextStringBuilder instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.StrLookup
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text StringLookupFactory instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.StrMatcher
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text StringMatcherFactory instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.StrSubstitutor
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text StringSubstitutor instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.StrTokenizer
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text StringTokenizer instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.AggregateTranslator
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text AggregateTranslator instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.CharSequenceTranslator
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text CharSequenceTranslator instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.CodePointTranslator
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text CharSequenceTranslator instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.EntityArrays
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text EntityArrays instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.JavaUnicodeEscaper
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text UnicodeEscaper instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.LookupTranslator
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text LookupTranslator instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.NumericEntityEscaper
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text NumericEntityEscaper instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.NumericEntityUnescaper
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text NumericEntityUnescaper instead

    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text OctalUnescaper instead

    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text UnicodeEscaper instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.UnicodeUnescaper
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text UnicodeUnescaper instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.translate.UnicodeUnpairedSurrogateRemover
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text UnicodeUnpairedSurrogateRemover instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.text.WordUtils
    As of 3.6, use Apache Commons Text WordUtils instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.ThreadUtils.NamePredicate
    Use a Predicate.
    org.sibermatica.lang.ThreadUtils.ThreadIdPredicate
    Use a Predicate.

    Use PathUtils.noFollowLinkOptionArray().

    Use FileFileFilter.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.io.HexDump.EOL
    Use System.lineSeparator().

    Use ClosedInputStream.INSTANCE.

    ClosedReader.INSTANCE.

    Use System.lineSeparator().

    Use ClosedOutputStream.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.io.output.ClosedWriter.CLOSED_WRITER
    Use ClosedWriter.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.io.output.NullOutputStream.NULL_OUTPUT_STREAM
    Use NullOutputStream.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.io.output.NullPrintStream.NULL_PRINT_STREAM
    Use NullPrintStream.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.io.output.NullWriter.NULL_WRITER
    Use NullWriter.INSTANCE.
    org.sibermatica.lang.StringEscapeUtils.ESCAPE_XML
    use StringEscapeUtils.ESCAPE_XML10 or StringEscapeUtils.ESCAPE_XML11 instead.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.FILE_SEPARATOR
    Use File.separator, since it is guaranteed to be a string containing a single character and it does not require a privilege check.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.IS_JAVA_1_9
    As of release 3.5, replaced by SystemUtils.IS_JAVA_9
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.JAVA_HOME_KEY
    Use SystemProperties.JAVA_HOME.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.JAVA_IO_TMPDIR_KEY
    Use SystemProperties.JAVA_IO_TMPDIR.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.LINE_SEPARATOR
    Use System.lineSeparator() instead, since it does not require a privilege check.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.PATH_SEPARATOR
    Use File.pathSeparator, since it is guaranteed to be a string containing a single character and it does not require a privilege check.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.USER_DIR_KEY
    Use SystemProperties.USER_DIR.
    org.sibermatica.lang.SystemUtils.USER_NAME_KEY
    Use SystemProperties.USER_NAME.
    org.sibermatica.lang.ThreadUtils.ALWAYS_TRUE_PREDICATE
    Use a Predicate.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_DATE_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_DATE_FORMAT will be replaced by ISO_8601_EXTENDED_DATE_FORMAT.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_DATE_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_DATE_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT will be removed.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_DATETIME_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_DATETIME_FORMAT will be replaced by ISO_8601_EXTENDED_DATETIME_FORMAT.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_DATETIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_DATETIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT will be replaced by ISO_8601_EXTENDED_DATETIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_TIME_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_TIME_FORMAT will be removed.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_TIME_NO_T_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_TIME_NO_T_FORMAT will be replaced by ISO_8601_EXTENDED_TIME_FORMAT.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_TIME_NO_T_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_TIME_NO_T_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT will be replaced by ISO_8601_EXTENDED_TIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT.
    org.sibermatica.lang.time.DateFormatUtils.ISO_TIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT
    - as of 4.0, ISO_TIME_TIME_ZONE_FORMAT will be removed.

    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(byte[], Writer)
    2.5 use IOUtils.write(byte[], Writer, Charset) instead
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(char[], OutputStream)
    2.5 use IOUtils.write(char[], OutputStream, Charset) instead
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(CharSequence, OutputStream)
    2.5 use IOUtils.write(CharSequence, OutputStream, Charset) instead
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(StringBuffer, OutputStream)
    Use IOUtils.write(CharSequence, OutputStream)
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(StringBuffer, OutputStream, String)
    Use IOUtils.write(CharSequence, OutputStream, String).
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(StringBuffer, Writer)
    Use IOUtils.write(CharSequence, Writer)
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.write​(String, OutputStream)
    2.5 use IOUtils.write(String, OutputStream, Charset) instead
    org.sibermatica.io.IOUtils.writeLines​(Collection<?>, String, OutputStream)
    2.5 use IOUtils.writeLines(Collection, String, OutputStream, Charset) instead
    org.sibermatica.io.LineIterator.closeQuietly​(LineIterator)
    As of 2.6 deprecated without replacement. Please use the try-with-resources statement or handle suppressed exceptions manually.
    org.sibermatica.io.output.AbstractByteArrayOutputStream.toString()
    2.5 use AbstractByteArrayOutputStream.toString(String) instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.ArrayUtils.add​(boolean[], int, boolean)
    this method has been superseded by ArrayUtils.insert(int, boolean[], boolean...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.
    org.sibermatica.lang.ArrayUtils.add​(byte[], int, byte)
    this method has been superseded by ArrayUtils.insert(int, byte[], byte...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.

    this method has been superseded by ArrayUtils.insert(int, char[], char...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.

    this method has been superseded by ArrayUtils.insert(int, double[], double...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.

    this method has been superseded by ArrayUtils.insert(int, float[], float...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.

    this method has been superseded by insert(int, T[], T...) and may be removed in a future release. Please note the handling of null input arrays differs in the new method: inserting X into a null array results in null not X.

    org.sibermatica.lang.CharEncoding.isSupported​(String)
    Please use Charset.isSupported(String) instead, although be aware that null values are not accepted by that method and an IllegalCharsetNameException may be thrown.
    org.sibermatica.lang.CharUtils.toCharacterObject​(char)
    Java 5 introduced Character.valueOf(char) which caches chars 0 through 127.
    org.sibermatica.lang.exception.ExceptionUtils.getCause​(Throwable)
    This feature will be removed in Lang 4, use Throwable.getCause() instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.exception.ExceptionUtils.getCause​(Throwable, String[])
    This feature will be removed in Lang 4, use Throwable.getCause() instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.exception.ExceptionUtils.getDefaultCauseMethodNames()
    This feature will be removed in Lang 4
    org.sibermatica.lang.math.NumberUtils.isNumber​(String)
    This feature will be removed in Lang 4, use NumberUtils.isCreatable(String) instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.equals​(Object, Object)
    this method has been replaced by java.util.Objects.equals(Object, Object) in Java 7 and will be removed from future releases.
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.hashCode​(Object)
    this method has been replaced by java.util.Objects.hashCode(Object) in Java 7 and will be removed in future releases
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.hashCodeMulti​(Object...)
    this method has been replaced by java.util.Objects.hash(Object...) in Java 7 and will be removed in future releases.
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.identityToString​(StrBuilder, Object)
    as of 3.6, because StrBuilder was moved to commons-text, use one of the other identityToString methods instead
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.toString​(Object)
    this method has been replaced by java.util.Objects.toString(Object) in Java 7 and will be removed in future releases. Note however that said method will return "null" for null references, while this method returns an empty String. To preserve behavior use java.util.Objects.toString(myObject, "")
    org.sibermatica.lang.ObjectUtils.toString​(Object, String)
    this method has been replaced by java.util.Objects.toString(Object, String) in Java 7 and will be removed in future releases.
    org.sibermatica.lang.Range.between​(T, T)
    Use Range.of(Comparable, Comparable).
    org.sibermatica.lang.Range.between​(T, T, Comparator<T>)
    Use Range.of(Object, Object, Comparator).
    org.sibermatica.lang.reflect.FieldUtils.removeFinalModifier​(Field, boolean)
    As of Java 12, we can no longer drop the final modifier, thus rendering this method obsolete. The JDK discussion about this change can be found here: https://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/core-libs-dev/2018-November/056486.html
    org.sibermatica.lang.stream.Streams.stream​(Collection<E>)
    Use Streams.failableStream(Collection).

    Use Streams.failableStream(Stream).

    This feature will be removed in Lang 4, use StringUtils.removeEnd(String, String) instead
